--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Michael Holly" <mholly@t...> wrote:
> texanworker
> 
> I would be interested to know how you are running junit.

The Redhat 9 problem was fixed.  The solution was to have a
classpath that looked like:
$JUNIT_HOME:$JUNIT_HOME/junit.jar
which was embarrassingly obvious once I stopped to think about it.

However, the problem in Redhat 8 existed for an apparently different
reason.  The local Linux expert believes that there is an error in
the C library called.  This error showed up in jdb, so it may be
a problem for the developer list.


>  I too have a
> classpath problem that I cannot figure out.  I am running builds
with ant
> and have a junit target.
[snip]
> Does the line "[junit] Running test.myco.tsr.AllTests" mean that it
found
> my test cases?  The error indicates the opposite.


I don't know, but I will try setting up a similar ant project and
I will try to reproduce the behavior.

Is it possible that it found one of the classes needed for AllTests
but could not find the others?  I suspect that's what's happening.

It is interesting to note that even with the wrong path, in 
Redhat 9, I got something similar to your case -- I could get the
swingui to run, but it could not find some or all of the test
classes needed.

I believe your problem is similar to that Redhat problem.  I will
try to use ant to produce more definite data.



> 
> Is your setup bombing because it can't find junit.jar or your test
> class(es)?
> 
> 
> 

I believe the first bomb was because it didn't have both of the
elements it needed.  In Redhat 9 it works if given
$JUNIT_HOME:$JUNIT_HOME/junit.jar

whereas if memory serves, in Redhat 8 it didn't even work with
that classpath -- it bombed on a line of code where Java tried to
call a system-level command and failed.

The first element $JUNIT_HOME is what allows it to find the test
classes.  I suspect that might be what is missing in your case.

At first glance, this kind of classpath seems inefficient to me.
However, it may be that the designers liked it.

I will keep you posted as I learn more.
